FTP1.TENNECO.COM User Removal

  1. After Entitlement removes the user id from the server they will send the UNIX Team a ticket to remove the user id from the server. Make the following changes substituting the user name from the ticket where applicable.
  2. Remove the users unique group
    sudo rmgroup '-p' {user login here}
  3. Remove the users home directory from /prod/ftp
    cd /prod/ftp

    Then 

    sudo rm -r {user login here}
  4. Modify ssh config file to remove the user id from the appropriate stanza in /etc/ssh/sshd_config
    sudo cp /etc/ssh/sshd_config /etc/ssh/sshd_config.$(date +%Y%m%d-%H:%M:%S).yn
    sudo vi /etc/ssh/sshd_config

    Remove the username to the end of the stanza “Example of overriding settings on a per-user basis”

  5. Save the file and restart the ssh daemon so the change takes effect 
    sudo kill -HUP $(lssrc -a |grep sshd | awk '{print $3}')
